# Module :: deskinparser.libutilities:¶

  • Created on Wed Jul 26 10:29:43 2017
  • Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

The common methods and constants useful for deskin parser functionality and not restricted to a singel module or a single class. One can call these variables global dependencies for the parser functionality

libutilities.BASIC_TEN_SLOT_TYPE = 10

The basic format of a line (a token definition) in CoNLL format

libutilities.COMPOUND_DEFINITION = 11

A newer addition that represents the contraction (e.g. du = de + le) that has been split into two tokens. The representation is the token IDs that are originaly together.

libutilities.DETAIL_RELATION = 9

Defining the connection of an unit element to a relation through both the existance of the element in a particuler relation and whether it is the head or the dependance.

libutilities.EXTERNAL_EMBEDDING = 7

Some sort of external embedding

libutilities.GPOS = 2

Pertaining to general PoS of a unit element

libutilities.HASH_BLOCKSIZE = 65536

Default buffer size for file hash generation

libutilities.LEMMA = 1

Pertaining to lemma of a unit element

libutilities.META_EXTENSION = '.cmeta'

Extension for the metadata file

libutilities.MORPH = 4

Pertaining to morphological definition of a unit element

libutilities.ONE_HOT_VECTOR = 6

One hot encoded vector

libutilities.ONE_HOT_VECTOR_DIMENSION_MULTIPLIER = 1.5

In case of one hot encoded vector definition the vector size multiplier allows the accomodation of new entitis to be incorporated in the vector.

libutilities.POS = 3

Pertaining to deailes or more granuler PoS of a unit element

libutilities.RELATION = 5

Pertaining to dependency relation of a unit element

libutilities.RELATION_DISTRIBUTION = 19

Metadata data structure keys for json export and import (range 12-19)

libutilities.SIMPLE_RELATION = 8

Defining the connection of an unit element to a relation through the existance of the element in a particuler relation

libutilities.TOKEN = 0

Pertaining to token or surface form of a unit element

libutilities.doesTheFileExist(file_path=None)

Method to check if file path (file_path) is correct and the file actually exists.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The full path of the file to be tested.
Returns:

True.
Return type:

bool
Raises:
  • noneFilePathError – If the the file path is None.
  • nonStringFilePathError – If the the file path is not a String.
  • zeroLengthStringPathError – If the the file path is a zero length String.
  • pathDoesNotExistError – If file path doesnot exist.
  • newFileIOError – The directory exists but the file does not.
  • pathIsDirectoryException – If the path is a directory.
 
>>> doesTheFileExist(file_path='/my/own/path/fakedata.conll')
True
libutilities.generate_hash(source_file=None)

Method to generate the hash value (SHA1) for the given input file (source_file). Primary use is the comparison of a file in two different time to test consistency.

Parameters:source_file (str) – The full path of the file to be hashed.
Returns:The hash code for the input file.
Return type:str
Raises:Exception – Source file path is not valid. 
>>> generate_hash(source_file='/my/own/path/fakedata.conll')
'328eabe02b7e4540531681be603d51c5a0d97c53'

Note

The source file cannot be None, has to be a String containing complete path and must exist.

libutilities.is_integer(test_val=None)

Method to test if the test value (test_val) is a valid integer or not. If the test value is an integer True will be returned other wise a False will be returned.

Parameters:test_val (str or int or float) – The value to be tested
Returns:True or False
Return type:bool 
>>> is_integer(test_val="23")
True
>>> is_integer(test_val=2.0)
True
>>> is_integer(test_val="2.33")
False

# Module :: deskinparser.libconll:¶

Created on Thu Jun 22 16:50:26 2017

Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

Module containing classes to process a CoNLL format text file for further use. The Primary use is as a sentence stream for quick travarsal of the content.

class libconll.CoNLLMetaData(input_file=None, meta_file=None)

The class that shall provide the data structure and the supporting methods to store, manipulate and access metadata extracted from a file in CoNLL format. CoNLL metadata initialization method will allow us to make decisions regarding metadata analysis, loading and saving.

Parameters:
  • input_file (str) – The input file in CoNLL format
  • meta_file (str) – The metadata file associated with the input_file
Returns:

Nothing.
Raises:

invalidFilePathException – If the input file path is invalid.

Note

The decisions making process of loading metadata or generate and eventually saving can be decribed by the following algorithm,

  • If the meatfile exists i.e. a valid path is provides and the file exists, we shall check if there is any thing in the file i.e. the length of the file is not zero.
  • Now we shall try to open the file.
  • Once opened we shall check if all the data keys are present.
  • If so we shall retrieve the input hash value and compare it with the calculated input file hash value to determine if the input file is the actual input file associeated with the metadata.
  • Failiure at any of the previous steps will invoce the analysis method thus genarating the metadata ans saving it.
  • If metadata file name provided exist the new metadata will be saved by rewriting the file.
  • Otherwise if the directory path of the metafile name exist or the metfile name is an existing directory itself, the new metadata will be saved in that directory.
  • For any other case the metafile will be generated in the same path where the input file is.
analyze(in_file=None)

Load and analyze the input file to generate metadata and update class level variables.

Parameters:

in_file (str) – The CoNLL format file to be analyzed.
Returns:

Nothing.
Raises:
  • IOError – If hash value generation for the input file fails.
  • IOError – By file access.
  • ValueError – By unicode file access.
  • ValueError – If invalid, non integer token ID is found.
  • TypeError – If invalidtoken type is found.
detect_token_type(tok=None)

Detects and returns the type of token as defined in the utility module.

Parameters:

tok (str) – The token definition for detection.
Returns:

token type defined in libutilities module.
Raises:
  • TypeError – If token definition is not a string.
  • zeroLengthValueError – If the token definition is empty.
  • undefinedTypeError – If undefined token type is detected.

Note

The token definitions types are defined in the utility module. Additional types can be introduced and the if-else block is needed to be updated to accomodate any new type.

get_generic_pos_count()

Returns the total number of unique generic PoS in the input file.

Returns:number of unique generic PoS.
Return type:int
get_generic_pos_distribution()

Map of token distribution i.e. map of generic PoS to its frequency.

Returns:map of generic PoS to its frequency.
Return type:map[str, int]
get_generic_pos_list()

Returns the list of unique generic PoS in the input file.

Returns:list of unique generic PoS.
Return type:list[str]

Returns:number of unique lemmas.
Return type:int

Returns the list of unique lemmas in the input file.

Returns:list of unique lemmas.
Return type:list[str]
get_morphological_class_value_map()

Returns the map of morphological class to its possible values.

Returns:map of morphological classes to values.
Return type:dict[str, list]
get_pos_count()

Returns the total number of unique fine-grained PoS in the input file.

Returns:number of unique fine-grained PoS.
Return type:int
get_pos_distribution()

Map of token distribution i.e. map of fine-grained PoS to its frequency.

Returns:map of fine-grained PoS to its frequency.
Return type:map[str, int]

Returns the list of unique fine-grained PoS in the input file.

Returns the total number of unique relation types in the input file.

Returns:number of unique relation types.
Return type:int

Returns the map of token distribution i.e. map of relation types to its frequency.

Returns:map of relation types to its frequency.
Return type:map[str, int]
get_relation_list()

Returns the list of unique relation types in the input file.

Returns:list of unique relation types.
Return type:list[str]
get_sentence_configuration(sentence_number=None)

Returns the sentence configurations for the input file either all the sentences or for a specific sentence. The formal way to get all configurations is to call the fuction without any arguments.

Parameters:sentence_number (int) – The specific sentence configuaration to return.
Returns:One or all the sentence configurations.
Return type:list(list(str, int)) or dict(int, list(list(str, int)))
Raises:KeyError – If the sentence_number does not exist.

Note

Sentence configuration is a list of tuples … token ID as found followed by the type of token that was found.

get_sentence_count()

Returns the number of sentences in the file.

Param:Nothing
Returns:The number of sentencs.
Return type:int
get_token_count()

Returns the total number of unique tokens in the input file.

Returns:number of unique tokens.
Return type:int
get_token_distribution()

Map of token distribution i.e. map of token to its frequency.

Returns:map of token to its frequency.
Return type:map[str, int]
get_token_list()

Returns the list of unique tokens in the input file.

Returns:list of unique tokens.
Return type:list[str]
load_metadate(meta_file=None, current_hash=-1)

Load meta data to class variables from the provided file.

Parameters:
  • meta_file (str) – The metafile path.
  • current_hash (str) – Hash value to be compared for consistency.
Returns:

Nothing
Raises:
  • IOError –

    By file access.

  • ValueError –

    By unicode file access.

  • zeroLengthValueError – If metafile is empty.
  • TypeError – If loaded data is not a dict.
  • notAllKeyError – If loaded data does not contain all the JSON data keys.
  • unequalValueError – If current hash does not match the saved hash value.
save_metadata(meta_file=None)

Save the extracted metadata into the provided metadata file.

Parameters:

meta_file (str) – The metafile path to save the data.
Returns:

Nothing
Raises:
  • IOError –

    By file access.

  • ValueError –

    By unicode file access.

  • ValueError – By JSON dump.
  • OverflowError –

    By JSON dump.

  • TypeError –

    By JSON dump.

Note

The default value of meta_file is a sheer formality because of the structure of the class. This function should only be called by the initialization method and that shall raise exceptions if there is some sort of anomaly in the file name or in the file path.

update_morphology_map(morph_string=None)

Updates the class variable for keeping the map of morphological classes (e.g. gender, number etc.) to the map of possible values (e.g. masculin, feminin etc. for gender) to their respective frequency.

Parameters:morph_string (str) – The morphological information string.
Returns:map of maps of morphological class to value to frequency.
Return type:dict[str, dict[str, int]]
class libconll.CoNLLReader(input_file=None, meta_file=None)

This class when instantiated will provide a reader object that can be used to access a CoNLL format text file. The specific benifits could be the direct access to sentences by index.

Parameters:
  • input_file (str) – The input file in CoNLL format
  • meta_file (str) – The metadata file associated with the input_file
Returns:

Nothing.
Raises:

metadataValueError – If the metadata object failed to initialize.
get_metadata()

Returns the total number of unique relation types in the input file.

Returns:The metadata data container for the input file.
Return type:CoNLLMetaData object
get_next_sentence()

Loads the next sentence with respect to the current position specified by **current_sentence*.*

Returns:The sentence buffer.
Return type:The sentence buffer data structure.
Raises:lastElementWarning – If the current sentence is the last sentence.
get_previous_sentence()

Loads the previous sentence with respect to the current position specified by **current_sentence*.*

Returns:The sentence buffer.
Return type:The sentence buffer data structure.
Raises:firstElementWarning – If the current sentence is the first sentence.
get_sentence()

Returns the current sentence buffer. However, if the buffer is empty the read_sentence() method will be called to load the buffer first.

Returns:The sentence buffer.
Return type:The sentence buffer data structure (see Note)
Raises:KeyError – If the sentence ID is unknown for the read call.
..Note::
The data structure is a list of lists where the inner list is the list of each component of a token definition in CoNLL format. The buffer itself represents one sentence.
read_sentence()

Reads the sentence referenced by the index number found in the class variable current_sentence and load it in the sentence buffer.

Returns:Nothing.
Raises:KeyError – If the sentence ID is unknown.

# Module :: deskinparser.libvector:¶

Created on Tue Jul 18 11:21:34 2017

Deskin - Orange Labs - Lannion - France

The module to generate vecors for a given file. Each vector shall represent one token and will be grouped by each sentence.

class libvector.CoNLLFileVector(reader=None)

The class when initiated with a CoNLLReader object, shall provide the framework to vectorize a file. It will also allow the vectorization to be configured. The base configuration is to use all the elements and one hot vector encoding for all components.

Parameters:

reader (libconll.CoNLLReader) – The CoNLLReader object to be vectorized.
Returns:

Nothing.
Raises:
  • noneValueError – If the value for reader is none.
  • TypeError – If the value for reader is not a CoNLLReader object.

Note

The vector configuration is a dictionary of key of each part of token information (i.e. surface form, lemma etc.) to a tupple of type of vector, vector data source and source format. The last 2 values are relevent if external embedding is used. If the type of vector is set to “None”

Note

The relation type defines the vector configuration of the relations. The simple type is just the vector for the relation. The detailed type adds a parity to define wheather the token is the source or the target of the relation.

generate_vector_profile(dim_multiplier=None)
get_base_dimension(key=None)
get_element_list(key=None)
update_configuration(key=None, vector_type=None, type_param=None)

The key method to manipulate the vector configuration. Each call may configure one vector part specified by the key. If custome embedding is selected as the vector type, a valid embedding data file with correct format value (default is Word2Vec Text Format) must be provided.

Parameters:
  • key (int) – The key to be configured.
  • vector_type (int) – The type of vector the key should be.
  • embedding_reader (externalEmbeddingReader) – For external embedding the reader object (see note).
Returns:

Nothing.
Raises:
  • noneValueError – If the key is none.
  • noneValueError – If the embedding reader is none.
  • KeyError – If the key does not exist in the vector configuration.
  • ValueError – If the vector_type is not valid.
  • TypeError – If the embedding reader object is not of valid type.

Note

The externalEmbeddingReader class is a generic class that is needed to be used to define specific classes for the embedding reader objects.
